title: Biological half-life
summary:
Biological half-life (also known as elimination half-life, pharmacologic half-life) of a biological substance such as medication is the time it takes from its maximum concentration (Cmax) to half of its maximum concentration in the blood plasma,[1][2][3][4][5][6] and is denoted by the abbreviation 
  
    
      
        
          t
          
            
              1
              2
            
          
        
      
    
    {\displaystyle t_{\frac {1}{2}}}
  
. [2][5]
